attributeList.name: clauses
attributeList.doc: Lists of clauses for each Max-3-SAT problem. Each clause is a list of three numbers. A value of n means that this refers to the nth variable. A positive value means that the variable must be true to satisfy the clause while a negative value means that variable must be false to satisfy the clause.

attributeList.name: hamiltonians
attributeList.doc: List of hamiltonians. Each Hamiltonian corresponds to one Max-3-SAT problem.

attributeList.name: ns
attributeList.doc: List containing the number of variables for each maxsat problem.

attributeList.name: ids
attributeList.doc: List containing the number of variables for each maxsat problem.

attributeList.name: instanceids
attributeList.doc: List containing numbers that identify a specific Max-3-SAT problem within a set of problems that have the same ratio and number of variables.

attributeList.name: ratios
attributeList.doc: List of clause ratios r = m/n, where m is the number of clauses and n is the number of variables.
